body_html:
After browsing through the code, I figure out that I need to create an AttrValue proto message. This works:

val attrValue = AttrValue.newBuilder()
  attrValue.setFunc(
    NameAttrList.newBuilder()
        .setName(value.name)
        .build())
// Then call the `TF_SetAttrValueProto` function with `attrValue.build().toByteArray`.

How come the attr name-value list is not needed? Could ignoring it have any implications?

body:
After browsing through the code, I figure out that I need to create an `AttrValue` proto message. This works:
```
val attrValue = AttrValue.newBuilder()
  attrValue.setFunc(
    NameAttrList.newBuilder()
        .setName(value.name)
        .build())
// Then call the `TF_SetAttrValueProto` function with `attrValue.build().toByteArray`.
```
How come the attr name-value list is not needed? Could ignoring it have any implications?
